intro: Dicliptera pilosa, commonly known as the hairy dicliptera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has narrow, linear leaves with a rough texture. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often clustered at the base of the plant. Dicliptera pilosa is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
